meanings.definition: In a bold or daring manner
meanings.sent1: She climbed the tree venturously, reaching the top with a big smile.
meanings.sent2: He walked venturously into the dark cave, eager to explore its depths.
meanings.sent3: The cat venturously pounced on the toy mouse, thinking it was real.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter venturously entered the burning building to save the trapped family.
meanings.sent5: The young explorer venturously crossed the rickety bridge over the roaring river.

meanings.definition: Showing a willingness to take risks or try new things
meanings.sent1: The venturously curious child always asked questions and sought new adventures.
meanings.sent2: She made a venturously bold decision to travel the world alone.
meanings.sent3: The venturously innovative chef created a unique dish that surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: His venturously creative approach to problem-solving led to groundbreaking discoveries.
meanings.sent5: The venturously ambitious entrepreneur started a successful business from scratch.
